sequence
Class ArraySequence<E>

java.lang.Object
  sequence.ArraySequence<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the element type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Deque<E>, IndexList<E>, java.lang.Iterable<E>, PositionList<E>, Sequence<E>
public class ArraySequence<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Sequence<E>

The ArraySequence implements Sequence interface with an array of ArrayPosition. When an ArraySequence is first created, it contains no items.

Version:
1.0
Author:
SuperJulietta

add

public void add(int index,
                E e)
Inserts the specified element at the specified position in this list. Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (adds one to their indices). When the Sequence become full this Sequence is changed with another Sequence(with double-size)containing all old elements and the newest one.

Specified by:
add in interface IndexList<E>
Parameters:
index - index at which the specified element is to be inserted.
e - element to be inserted.
Throws:
IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index given in input is not valid.

remove

public E remove(int i)
Removes the element at the specified position in this Sequence. Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (subtracts one from their indices).

Specified by:
remove in interface IndexList<E>
Parameters:
i - the index of the element to removed.
Returns:
the element that was removed from the Sequence.
Throws:
